newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian dollar ends softer in stable range.
newsitem.headline: Canadian dollar ends softer in stable range.

text.p: * Canada's dollar ended softer on Friday at C$1.3751 (US$0.7272) from Thursday's close of C$1.3729 (US$0.7283) in a stable range, traders said. * Bank of Canada Governor Gordon Thiessen said the central bank believed the nation's economy was fundamentally strong and that unemployment should gradually decline.

Thiessen rejected the interpretation that recent data showed an apparent drop in consumer confidence, and the speculation that a recent decline in Canada's retail sales and imports revealed a vulnerable economy.

The central bank governor said that past interest rate cuts should continue to support solid economic growth and that the Bank would remain committed to its inflation control target range of one to three percent.
"Because of the lags involved, the substantial past easing of interest rates should continue to support robust growth in domestic spending for some time," Thiessen said.
On the crosses, Canada's dollar fell to 83.94 yen from Thursday's close of 84.52 and dipped to 1.2306 marks from Thursday's 1.2342 marks.
